channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Changi Airport sets up new transit holding areas: 10 safety measures in place
item.description:
June 11, 2020 11:05 AM

SINGAPORE - Changi Airport has set up new Transit Holding Areas (THA) in Terminals 1 and 3 as it prepares for the gradual resumption of transit passenger services.

item.title: 95,000 employers to get $450 million in wage credit payouts by June 30
item.description:
June 11, 2020 10:17 AM

SINGAPORE - More than 95,000 employers will receive over $450 million in payouts this month under the Wage Credit Scheme (WCS).

item.title: Coronavirus: Changi Airport sets up new transit holding areas, as SIA travellers from Australia, NZ allowed to fly through S'pore
item.description:
June 11, 2020 9:18 AM

The transit flights are only for outbound journeys from Australian cities Adelaide,Brisbane, Melbourne, Perth, Sydney, as well as New Zealand cities Auckland and Christchurch.

item.title: Digital and social resilience key to emerging stronger from Covid-19 pandemic: Indranee Rajah
item.description:
June 11, 2020 8:35 AM

SINGAPORE - When a group of hawker and market association chairmen spoke to Minister in the Prime Minister's Office Indranee Rajah last week, they were a bundle of nerves over having to use the video conferencing tool Zoom for the first time.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on June 11
item.description:
June 11, 2020 7:47 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Thursday, June 11.

item.title: Five students, one school employee cleared of Covid-19
item.description:
June 11, 2020 5:00 AM

Five students and one school employee who were confirmed to have Covid-19 on Sunday have all recovered, the Ministry of Health (MOH) said yesterday.

item.title: Jobs for disabled people should be national issue: Halimah
item.description:
June 11, 2020 5:00 AM

Jobs for people with disabilities should be planned at the national level, President Halimah Yacob said yesterday.

item.title: Conditional HSA nod for use of remdesivir in serious Covid-19 cases
item.description:
June 11, 2020 5:00 AM

Antiviral drug remdesivir can now be administered to seriously ill Covid-19 patients, making Singapore one of the few countries to get the nod to use it to treat the virus.

item.title: S'pore Poly combines 8 programmes into one diploma
item.description:
June 11, 2020 5:00 AM

Students who want to study media, arts and design at Singapore Polytechnic (SP) will be able to try out different specialisations before deciding on one, which was not possible previously.

item.title: Coronavirus: Research that led to antiviral drug started in 2009
item.description:
June 11, 2020 5:00 AM

The research that led to Gilead Sciences' antiviral drug remdesivir began as early as 2009, with various programmes related to hepatitis C and respiratory syncytial virus.

item.title: Mum, son in probe over racial slurs on Instagram
item.description:
June 11, 2020 5:00 AM

A Singaporean woman and her son are under investigation for using racial slurs and vulgarities on Instagram with the intent to "wound the racial feelings of others", the police said yesterday.

item.title: Coronavirus vaccine search not a contest - multiple players needed: Pharma giant
item.description:
June 11, 2020 5:00 AM

The urgent search for a Covid-19 vaccine should not be seen as a competition, British pharmaceutical giant GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) said in noting efforts by multiple players around the world to prevent infections.

item.title: ST, German firm launch survey on best law firms here
item.description:
June 11, 2020 5:00 AM

The Straits Times and German research firm Statista have launched a survey on the best law firms in Singapore.

item.title: Singapore-based firm to start human trials for potential coronavirus drug
item.description:
June 11, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore will embark on human clinical trials next week with 23 healthy individuals for a potential treatment for Covid-19.

item.title: Woman who allegedly spat at KFC employee charged in court
item.description:
June 11, 2020 5:00 AM

A woman who allegedly pulled down her mask and spat at an employee at a KFC outlet was charged in court yesterday.

item.title: Coronavirus: Pros and cons of monoclonal antibodies
item.description:
June 11, 2020 5:00 AM

Monoclonal antibodies are immune system proteins that are created in the laboratory, and can be specially designed and engineered to target Sars-CoV-2, the virus that causes Covid-19.

item.title: 5 sentenced over separate offences linked to Covid-19
item.description:
June 11, 2020 5:00 AM

A beauty salon owner breached circuit breaker measures to provide massage and sexual services amid the Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: Doctor accused of molestation, rape cleared of all charges
item.description:
June 11, 2020 5:00 AM

General practitioner Wee Teong Boo, who was accused of raping and molesting a patient at his Bedok clinic, was completely cleared of all charges yesterday by the Court of Appeal.

item.title: New dorms coming up to house migrant workers
item.description:
June 11, 2020 5:00 AM

Work on a new Quick Build Dormitory (QBD) was in full swing at an empty plot of land next to Choa Chu Kang Avenue 7 yesterday. Eight such dormitories - temporary structures that can last two to three years - will be ready by the end of the year to house migrant workers who have been cleared of Covid-19.

item.title: Every effort being made to ensure no 'lost generation'
item.description:
June 11, 2020 5:00 AM

It is a challenging time to come of age for young people here, and the road ahead is fraught with uncertainty, but every effort is being made to ensure that there is no "lost generation" in Singapore, said Deputy Prime Minister Heng Swee Keat yesterday.

item.title: UOB Kay Hian donates $600,000 to ST School Pocket Money Fund
item.description:
June 11, 2020 5:00 AM

Stock brokerage company UOB Kay Hian has donated a total of $600,000 to The Straits Times School Pocket Money Fund (STSPMF).

item.title: Major gaming festival in S'pore postponed till next year
item.description:
June 11, 2020 5:00 AM

Gaming fans excited about a major gaming festival due to take place for the first time here in October will have to hit the pause button as it has been postponed due to concerns over the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Remdesivir can be used for serious Covid-19 cases in Singapore
item.description:
June 11, 2020 5:00 AM

An antiviral drug was approved to treat Covid-19 patients yesterday, while human trials will begin for another treatment next week.

item.title: S'pore's first woman general joins e2i
item.description:
June 11, 2020 5:00 AM

joined e2i in April after leaving the Singapore Armed Forces, and is expected to be fielded as a People's Action Party (PAP) candidate at the coming general election.

item.title: Coronavirus: Table shields could be used when dining at eateries is allowed
item.description:
June 11, 2020 5:00 AM

Acrylic table shields might be a regular sight at food and beverage (F&B) establishments when dining in is allowed again during phase two of the post-circuit breaker reopening.

item.title: 2,800 companies step up to offer 19,000 traineeships for new grads
item.description:
June 11, 2020 5:00 AM

About 2,800 companies have stepped up to offer over 19,000 traineeships for new graduates as part of initiatives to help them enter the workforce, Manpower Minister Josephine Teo said yesterday.

item.title: Coronavirus: 5,500 foreign workers from 40 dorms get nod to resume work
item.description:
June 11, 2020 5:00 AM

Some 5,500 migrant workers from 40 dormitories here were cleared to resume work from Tuesday, following the completion of necessary preparations.

item.title: China-based NTU alumni donate sanitiser, masks
item.description:
June 11, 2020 5:00 AM

A Nanyang Technological University (NTU) alumnus, who now heads a Chinese firm, has donated 100 cartons of food-grade hand sanitiser made by his company to Singapore.

item.title: Lawyer fined $5,600 for role in housing loan scam involving more than $2 million
item.description:
June 11, 2020 12:02 AM

SINGAPORE - A lawyer pleaded guilty and was fined $5,600 on Wednesday (June 10) for his role in a housing loan scam involving $2.32 million for the purchase of a house in Saraca Terrace off Yio Chu Kang Road.
